intro: Madaria elegans, commonly known as the elegant madaria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
